programme.title: Sortilegio
programme.desc: Alejandro returns home after a terrible accident to discover that he is married to Maria Jose, a poor, innocent girl who was deceived by Alejandro's brother Bruno. Bruno used Alejandro's name to marry Maria Jose, soon after he sent to kill his brother in hopes that Maria Jose would inherit Alejandro's fortune. But when Maria Jose arrives at the mansion she realizes that Bruno lied to her and used her. She is also scared when Alejandro is found alive and returns home. Doctors tell Alejandro that he suffers from memory loss but he is convinced he never met Maria Jose before and goes in search of the truth, but during this time and Maria Jose actually fall in love, while Bruno and Maura (Alejandro's ex-girlfriend) plot to break them up. Meanwhile, the brothers' mother Victoria has fallen in love with Fernando--Alejandro's best friend, so closer to his age than hers.

programme.title: Cops

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: In a desperate bid to avoid jail, a wanted man sprints across multiple lanes of traffic. A heated argument is taken to the next level when a woman starts smashing windows. A short-tempered driver takes his road rage way too far.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: Officers react quickly when a quiet passenger causes trouble during a traffic stop. One family gets a happy ending when a deputy safely recovers their stolen puppy. A struggling woman hits a speed bump on the road to recovery.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: A frantic fight between siblings ends with a stabbing. Officers arrest a delirious man after he attacked his brother and neighbor. Despite their no contact-order, police find a married couple hanging out in someone else's house.

programme.title: Quien Cocina Esta Noche
programme.desc: Encapsulates the essence of Latin American culture through cooking, bringing together renowned celebrities with talented chefs from the region to create special dinners that reflect the most emblematic flavors and culinary identity of the continent. Each episode is a sensory journey where the celebrity and the chef immerse themselves in the bustling streets, fertile fields, and vibrant markets of cities like Mexico City, Bogot, and Medelln, in search of fresh and authentic ingredients that will bring their culinary creations to life. The process of selecting ingredients becomes an exciting and revealing adventure, where stories, memories, and traditions linked to food are unveiled. The interaction between the celebrity and the chef not only involves the preparation of exquisite dishes but also opens a window to the intimacy and humanity of the participants. As they share anecdotes, life experiences, and moments of complicity, the viewer discovers deeper and more authentic facets of these personalities. With the participation of renowned singers such as Juanes, Carlos Vives, and Mike Baha, as well as entertainment figures like Mara Fernanda Yepes, Camila Sodi, Christian Chvez, Aaron Daz, and Ana Serradilla, each episode is imbued with talent, passion, and creativity. Viewers are immersed in a unique culinary journey, where music, art, and gastronomy intertwine to create an unforgettable multi sensory experience.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: The kingdom of Naples, covering southern Italy, had truly royal gardens. The Bourbon dynasty rivaled Versailles' gardens at Caserta, just before the geometrical fashion ended. Later gardens followed the English style of 'fake nature', only adapted to the Mediterranean climate.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.sub-title: The Veneto, Lucca and The Lakes
programme.desc: Italy north of Rome, mainly city states and the larger ones' hinterland, like Venice's, has many gardens belonging to country homes of rich patrician or merchant families. programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty bases himself at Rousham House in Oxfordshire, designed by one of the first practitioners of the landscape movement, William Kent. It has survived almost unchanged since its completion in 1741.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: In this episode, Steven Rinella steps out of the field and into the kitchen to showcase some of his favorite wild game recipes. From wild turkey sausage and smoked trout to venison ribs and duck breast, he shares simple yet sophisticated ways to prepare these dishes. This cooking masterclass is a celebration of wild game, offering both seasoned hunters and novice cooks new ways to enjoy the fruits of their hunts.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Steve heads to the panhandle of Idaho to join wildlife biologist and dedicated houndsman Bart George for a mountain lion hunt. Bruce Dunkin, Bart's mentor and hunting buddy, joins the crew as they attempt to cut a cat's track and let the dogs loose for a hunt in the deep timber of the Idaho mountains.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Steven Rinella and Evan Hafer head into Southeast Alaska's coastal rainforest to hunt Sitka black-tailed deer. Using deer calls and antler rattling to mimic buck fights, they navigate through thick muskegs and challenging terrain. Despite tough weather conditions and elusive game, the two friends adapt to the conditions and stick it out, making the most of their hunt.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Steven Rinella and Clay Newcomb head to Nebraska's Sandhills for a whitetail deer hunt, guided by Jordan Budd, an outfitter with a deep knowledge of the local terrain. As they navigate the wide-open spaces and cornfields, Jordan uses her expertise to narrow down the movement patters of the cagey bucks. The thick corn fields provide cover and food for the deer, making a tough hunt for the team.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Steven Rinella joins Jean-Paul Bourgeois and Ronnie Collins in Louisiana Mississippi Delta for a duck hunt. Surrounded by the unique landscape of the Delta, they target multiple duck species. After a successful hunt, the team returns to camp, where Jean-Paul prepares a traditional Cajun meal featuring the day catch. Experience the cultural tradition of turning fresh game into flavorful, local dishes like duck gumbo and crawfish boil.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Steven Rinella heads to New Mexico's Gila Wilderness with his friend Carl Malcolm to hunt Merriam's turkeys. Set against a backdrop of stunning landscapes and rich history, they explore the first federally protected wilderness in the world. Although few and far between, the duo find gobbling birds through hard scouting and perserverence.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Steven Rinella heads to the Gulf of Mexico for a spearfishing adventure beneath the oil rigs that serve as artificial reefs. Joined by his spearfishing mentor Greg Fonts and Brandon Hendrickson, they target a variety of prized fish, including Cobia and red snapper. The episode captures the thrill of diving in murky waters filled with sharks and navigating the massive structures. Along the way, they showcase the rich marine life of the Gulf and the skills needed to harvest fresh seafood.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Steven Rinella, Ryan Callahan, and Danny Bolton travel to Hawaii's Big Island for a unique hunt. They stalk feral sheep in the lush mountainsides and target wild hogs on a coffee plantation, using the animals' movements through macadamia groves to their advantage. The episode highlights Hawaii's blend of hunting and conservation, ending with a Hawaiian-style feast featuring the fresh game they harvested.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Steven Rinella teams up with spearfishing champions Danny Bolton and Kimi Werner off Hawaii coast for a thrilling underwater adventure. Targeting pelagic species like Mahi Mahi and yellowfin tuna, the crew navigates the deep blue waters, dodging sharks and learning to use fish aggregating devices (FADs) to attract game fish. After they spear a variety of species, including a massive Ono, the team ends with a fresh, ocean-to-table feast, celebrating the rich marine life of Hawaii.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: In this episode of MeatEater, Steven Rinella and Clay Newcomb head into Alaska's remote interior for a challenging moose hunt. Over a 10-day season, they navigate the rugged wilderness, using patient calling to attract moose. Finding a legal bull and navigating through thick vegetation are just two of the challenges faced on this trip. The hunt captures the essence of moose hunting: patience, adaptation, and persistence in one of the worlds wildest places.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Hunter, author, cook and conservationist Steven Rinella treks into the world's most remote and beautiful regions, bringing game meat from field to table. On this hunt, Steve introduces Randall Williams and Clay Newcomb to his fish shack in Prince of Wales, Alaska where they fish for cod, set shrimp pots and hunt for black bears.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Hunter, author, cook and conservationist Steven Rinella treks into the world's most remote and beautiful regions, bringing game meat from field to table. Steve jets off to his home state of Michigan to hunt for small game with friends Guy Zuck and Kevin Murphy.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Hunter, author, cook and conservationist Steven Rinella treks into the world's most remote and beautiful regions, bringing game meat from field to table. On this trip, Steve and Jason Phelps hunt for big mule deer in one of Idaho's most prized units, giving Steve an opportunity at his dream muley.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Hunter, author, cook and conservationist Steven Rinella treks into the world's most remote and beautiful regions, bringing game meat from field to table. On this hunt, Steve and Janis Putelis are in Florida with local, Richard Martinez, in search for the illusive Osceola Turkey.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Hunter, author, cook and conservationist Steven Rinella treks into the world's most remote and beautiful regions, bringing game meat from field to table. Steve heads down to the Bahamas to spearfish with friends Kimi Werner and Cameron Kirkconnell. They explore the clear waters of the North Atlantic to bring home a wide array of fish species, including Mahi Mahi and grouper.
